revised_title: Comparing Observations of Mars Parallax and the Sun's Horizontal Parallax
tldr: Monsieur De L'Isle of the Royal Academy of Sciences at Paris compares observations made by James Bradley and Charles de la Caille on the parallax of Mars and the horizontal parallax of the Sun. He calculates the horizontal parallax of Mars at the time of opposition and concludes that it is approximately 27 minutes and 20 seconds. He also discusses the upcoming transit of Mercury in May and his calculations for the ingress and emersion times.
